greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) giving the number of terms of A219666 which have n digits (A084558) in their factorial base expansion and whose most significant digit (A099563) in that base is k.
comment: See A007623 for the factorial number system representation.
example: The first rows of this triangular table are:

T(4,2) = 5 as only the terms 48, 52, 57, 63 and 70 of A219666 (with factorial base representations 2000, 2020, 2111, 2211 and 2320) have four significant digits in the factorial base, with the most significant digit being 2.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 18 2013
